awesome!!! the steps are towards the end part of an hour long run!!! great cardio-kick-a** climb with a beautiful view of the bay & the palace of fine arts!!!  prior to the steps is the gradual climb up the hill, so by the time i reach the bottom of the stairs, i'm somewhat light-headed.  

have yet to go straight up the steps without taking breaks. its my challenge to make it to the top without a break everytime............one day.......... 

mae sums it up pretty well how i'm feeling when i reach the top of the steps, completely out of breath:   "everything is starry.  Five stars, ten, 20, they keep spinning too.  Fireworks!"
author: Cindi N.

description: The Lyon Street Steps are located two blocks away from my apartment and I go up and down them everyday!  What motivates me to go is the fantastic view from the top of the steps.
author: Allison S.

description: Great views, a good place to take out of town visitors to catch that sense of what the city of San Francisco is about. You can also walk straight to Presidio from there.
author: Julia A.

description: I use to hang out here and drink in high school, if your in high school, this USE to be a great place to hang out and drink. Haha, "I don't know what your talking about officer that cold 40 oz. was here when I got here-- what, yeah go ahead and dump it out in the bush" haha. Dianne Feinstein lives at the foot of them now, and last week I was walking down them at like one AM and there was SFPD reading a news paper out side her house. I guess that all the 'kids' will be doing their drinking over at alta plaza.
author: David P.

description: an old friend used to live/work a block up from here.  we would often charge the steps for intense stair climbing, or while strolling and chatting.  there are always people going up and down the stairs as part of their workout regimen.  the views from the steps are breath taking.
author: Sheri N.

description: great place to come and get your butt worked and enjoy the view. i'm feeling the pain but i kinda like it so i'll be back. =)
author: Linda N.

description: These steps are pure insanity! I can't enjoy the view around me because I'm trying to focus on living. Just kidding when I make it to the top and I'm struggling to catch my breath I have a couple seconds to enjoy the beautiful view. Add this to your gym routine and you wont regret it. Some ppl who do these steps are hardcore, but usually when I go there is usually a good mix of ppl who run these steps.
author: Jennie B.

description: my, oh my... a fine workout no matter your fitness level.  a tip for the uninitiated -- make the effort to plant your whole foot on each step.  you'll generally get a better workout through your whole leg, and you might even be able to walk the next day.
author: Nat K.

description: these steps make for a great workout, and it's easy to get motivated to get ot the top when the view is so beautiful.  truly amazing.
author: Helen T.

description: Perfect makeout spot if you have a large enough trust fund to bribe the cops into pretending that they "never saw that 40oz" that you were holding.
author: Bethany D.

description: oh good... my legs still exist today.
author: Coco E.

description: The Lyon Street Steps are a staple in San Francisco, and we as San Franciscans trying to get our butts in shape are oh-so-lucky to have them. Sure, they kick your ass- they really do- even walking. But-- the view is priceless (so even if you have to stop and catch your breath half way ... or more often.... the view will be worth it), you can customize your workout, and seeing the majority of people there looking hot and fit even when they're well into middle age is an inspiration in itself to stay motivated. Also to be noted is that even on a foggy day the area is beautiful, just bundle up and you'll warm up as you get going..
author: Rebecca M.

description: Either I'm really out of shape or these stairs are just really hard. Nonetheless, I really enjoy coming here. The view is awesome, the workout is great, and the people who run these stairs always get out of the way if you're going faster than them. Everytime I come here, I'm reminded of how lucky I am to live in such a beautiful city.
author: Roger R.

description: A-ok is right.  I went here today and I don't know what the giant deal is about these steps.  Also, where the f is all that topiary shown in the picture?  It is pretty, but I was expecting some kind of magical secret garden- instead it's kind of busy, with runners bypassing the walkers every couple of feet.  Also, how does one run up these stairs without dying?  I would like to know.  There's not really anything to do after reaching the top, besides going back down and then leaving to do something more fun.  Maybe it'd be more fun if I were drunk- but probably a rich white person would see me from the widow's peak in his ginormous mansion palace, whilst drinking tea and eating crumpets and call the cops.   It's an all right spot to stumble upon, but I would not recommend it as a destination, unless your destination choice is yup-ville and you are inclined to walk up a million steps by some mansions.
author: Liza W.

description: Great workout (did only 4 sets on Saturday and still can't feel my calves on Monday) with a killer view.  I counted 291 steps (way off from what others have posted) but that might be attributable to the lack of oxygen in my brain at the time.  I recommend going early in the AM on weekends before it gets too crowded.  The lower part of the stairs gets narrow and there are some bruisers (aka - fatties) walking up the steps and they are tough to get around.  I am not sure if it is the norm, but there was also a healthy dog-turd on one of the steps last Saturday.  Minus one star.  Would have been minus two if I would have stepped in it.  Three if I was barefoot.
author: Matt A.

description: Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful, there is no other word to describe these steps!  The view is amazing, the surroundings are chique and green at the same time, and there's lots of peoplewatching to be done.  I really admire people using these steps in their workout, but I don't think I'm there yet, I just walk them...
author: Marijke D.

description: i've been coming here since the good old days of drinking 40's, running from the cops and kegs at the palace.  i now appreciate it for its beauty and nostalgic san francisco feeling; and it still attracts the occasional hoodlum.
author: Genevieve M.

description: My calves are screaming with pain after yesterday's stair climb.  It was brutal, humbling, and in a strange way....good.
author: B J.
